intro: Thesium asperifolium, commonly known as the rough-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and linear, often hairy leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are small and yellowish-green, arranged in loose clusters, and it produces distinctive seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Thesium asperifolium is often found in coastal or inland fynbos vegetation, and it is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
